title: Fairchild Beach
text:
Fairchild Beach () is a sandy beach, wide and long, which extends north from the base of <a href="Round%20Hill%20%28Heard%20Island%29">Round Hill</a> to the south side of the <a href="glacier%20terminus">terminus</a> of <a href="Compton%20Glacier">Compton Glacier</a>, on the east side of <a href="Heard%20Island">Heard Island</a> in the southern <a href="Indian%20Ocean">Indian Ocean</a>. The beach faces <a href="Compton%20Lagoon">Compton Lagoon</a>, and at its western edge communicates with the rocky <a href="Gilchrist%20Beach">Gilchrist Beach</a>. To the south of Fairchild Beach is <a href="Brown%20Glacier">Brown Glacier</a>, whose terminus is located at <a href="Brown%20Lagoon">Brown Lagoon</a>.
The name "Fairchild's Beach" was in use by <a href="People%20of%20the%20United%20States">American</a> <a href="Seal%20hunting">sealers</a> as early as 1857, but the origin of the name is not known.
